page.title: 10Blean Bird Park
page.content: In Blean Bird Park, started ten years ago by the present owner is a collection of birds mostly belonging to the parrot family. On this twenty acre site are over six hundred parrots, the largest collection in Europe. Some of these are free-flying in the park. The collection includes macaws, cockatoos, parakeets, owls, soft bills, peacocks and pheasants with an emphasis on breeding pairs to help those species in danger of extinction.Some of the parrots talk to the visitors. The chestnut trees,many of them very ancient are much appreciated by the nesting woodpeckers. The owner has recently had problems with continuation of planning consent for the Bird garden which is visited by thousands of tourists each year.
